description: Call this function when the flattened struct info you receive has got a named type instead of pure-native Go types.  Named types are present in the flattened struct type when the type is a union type.  Look in the test data for the discriminator value used to select the union type, and present that along with the type name. Use the FULL package path of the type as found in the imports block of the file.

discriminator.description: The value given in the test data that selects the union type.

typeName.description: The name of the interface type at the corresponding position of the struct, to the union type being instantiated.

pkgPath.description: The full package path of the type.  Leave blank if the type has no package alias (and is therefore defined in the current package).
